name: screamer
content:
screamer noun [C]
(PERSON)
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone who screams (= cries out loudly in a high voice): He heard the screams before he saw the screamer. I dug my fingernails into the beauty therapist's table, determined not to be the first screamer.
someone who shouts a lot, especially in an angry way: The screamer uses rage and temper tantrums to intimidate. Her boss was a screamer, demeaning and embarrassing her and her co-workers in public. After tolerating foul language for years from overaggressive sideline screamers, college referees intend to clean up bad language.
someone who sings in a very loud, high-pitched way: He's a screamer and by the end of the show, it sounded like he'd screeched the flesh off his throat.

screamer noun [C]
(VIDEO)
an internet video that pretends to be an image, game, test, etc. but is intended to frighten or shock you unexpectedly: How can you avoid screamers on YouTube? Screamers are uploaded to a site by pranksters, and they can be both surprising and upsetting.

screamer noun [C]
(EXCELLENT THING)
informal something that is extremely good: It's an absolute screamer of a deal. My current computer was built in March 2009 but it's still a screamer.
informal mainly UK a very good shot or kick, especially one that is hit hard and that travels a long distance, or a goal, etc. that is scored from such a shot: He finished off by diving way to his left and catching a screamer. United scored an absolute screamer.
